title: India’s Adani tries to pacify investors as watchdog probes report
description: Adani Group's seven listed stocks have together lost about $120bn in market value since US short-seller raised concerns.

title: US reveals more details on flying ‘objects’ as questions swirl
description: White House says objects shot down over North America were not manned and did not appear to send communication signals.

title: Rescue phase ‘comes to a close’ in Turkey-Syria quake disaster
description: Stories of miraculous rescues flooded the airwaves in recent days, but tens of thousands of dead have also been found.

title: Can US intervention stop the violence in the occupied West Bank?
description: Israel plans to step up its military raids on Palestinians across the occupied West Bank.

title: Ukraine: NATO in logistics ‘race’ as Russian offensive begins
description: NATO members meet on Tuesday to drum up more weapons and ammunition for war-torn Ukraine.

title: What will decide Nigeria’s general election?
description: Front-runners for presidency appeal to millions of voters worried about economic problems and insecurity.

title: Waiting into the night for a miracle rescue in Antakya
description: A week after earthquakes struck, Turkish rescue crews refuse to give up and find a teenage girl in the rubble.

title: US judge orders partial release of Georgia’s Trump election probe
description: Portions of special panel's report on push to overturn 2020 vote to be made public, but not recommendations on charges.

title: Analysis: Is Istanbul ready for a major earthquake?
description: Scientists say the megalopolis of 16 million people should get ready now for the inevitability of a powerful quake.

title: Earthquake piles misery on war-ravaged Jandaris in Aleppo region
description: Looking for pieces of ‘home’, survivors in Jandaris comb through the devastation for personal possessions.

title: Atlanta: Police shooting of activist fuels ‘Cop City’ controversy
description: Killing has not halted US city's plans to build a police training centre in the heart of majority-Black neighbourhoods.

title: Why was northwest Syria abandoned?
description: No, the UN's hands were not tied due to 'logistical issues' or decisions by the Security Council.

title: Moldovan president warns of Russian agent infiltration
description: Maia Sandu says Moscow plans to 'overthrow the constitutional order' in Moldova and use it in the war against Ukraine.

title: ‘I didn’t think we’d find any survivors’: White Helmets volunteer
description: A volunteer from Syria's White Helmets group recounts her experience in search and rescue operations after quake struck.

title: China accuses US of flying over 10 balloons over its airspace
description: Washington issues swift denial to Beijing's allegation, which widens row after downing of what US says was spy balloon.

title: In quake-hit Kahramanmaras, the stench of death lingers
description: In the midst of debris, dust and toxic smoke rising from fires lit to stay warm, the smell of dead bodies is growing.

title: Humanity at work
description: Amid the pain and suffering after the earthquake in Turkey and Syria, rescues from the rubble give us a glimmer of hope.

title: The issues at stake in Nigeria’s presidential vote for investors
description: Ahead of the presidential election on February 25, the business community is hopeful of a market-friendly government.

title: Colombia peace talks with ELN rebels set to resume amid tensions
description: Questions abound ahead of new round of negotiations, but experts say effort remains 'best choice among bad options'.

title: Pakistan Super League T20 cricket tournament set to begin
description: This year's event will be the first time when four of the six teams will boast the support of a home crowd.

title: Watch: Quake survivors still being rescued in Turkey one week on
description: People buried under rubble for up to seven days are still being pulled out alive.

title: Shahabuddin Chuppu declared next Bangladesh president-elect
description: Election Commission says the ruling Awami League party nominee was elected unopposed as the 22nd president.

title: Over 4,000 children abused by Portugal’s Catholic Church: Report
description: A commission investigating the issue said 77 percent of perpetrators were priests, and most of the victims were men.

title: Who is Cyprus’s president-elect Nikos Christodoulides?
description: Christodoulides ran as an independent candidate and had the backing of centrists and centre-right parties.

title: Iran’s Raisi leads large delegation in first state visit to China
description: Senior Iranian officials, including the central bank chief, accompany the Iranian president on the three-day visit.

title: Israelis stage protests near parliament against judicial reforms
description: Thousands protest outside parliament against the proposed amendments that critics say will weaken democracy.

title: NW Syria’s stricken residents come together to feed rescue teams
description: People in quake-stricken areas are doing their best to help the rescuers working day and night to help them.

title: Cameroon president’s 90th birthday marked by cocktail of woes
description: President Biya, in power since 1982, is on his seventh term as Cameroon's leader. Many say it is time for a change.

title: How Nigerian youth are galvanising for upcoming presidential vote
description: Over a third of Nigeria's 93.4 million registered voters are youths who are gearing up to vote in February 25 election.

title: What we know about the mysterious flying objects downed by the US
description: US fighter jets have shot down four flying objects in nine days. Here is what we know so far.

title: Zia Mohyeddin, legendary Pakistani artist and orator, dies at 91
description: The celebrated performer died in a hospital in Karachi where he was on life support.

title: Israel legalises nine settler outposts in occupied West Bank
description: Settlements in the Palestinian territories are illegal under international law and have been condemned by the UN.

title: Cambodia’s Hun Sen shuts down independent media outlet
description: Rights groups say the closure of the media outlet VOD is a devastating attack on what remains of Cambodia’s free press.

title: After the earthquakes, war-hit Syrians struggle to get aid
description: The earthquakes displaced many in Syria for a second time, forcing some to sleep under olive groves in the winter.

title: ‘Only bones left’: Turkey families look for remains as hopes fade
description: Anger is mounting as rescuers say they could have saved many more people with better help from the government.

title: What does the future look like for female cricket umpires?
description: Female umpires are more visible than ever on the field, but more is needed from the authorities.

title: Month later, rehabilitation eludes residents in India’s Joshimath
description: As houses and roads began to crack, about 240 families were temporarily relocated and many others fled Himalayan town.

title: Manila accuses China of ‘dangerous’ manoeuvres in South China Sea
description: Philippine Coast Guard says Chinese used 'military-grade laser' against a ship carrying supplies to the Sierra Madre.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 355
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 355th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Auckland hunkers down as Cyclone Gabrielle nears
description: Flights suspended and schools closed as New Zealand's biggest city braces for second major storm in as many weeks.

title: Explosions in Gaza after Israeli air raids
description: The Palestinian Red Crescent says one person was killed in a pre-dawn Israeli army raid in Nablus.

title: Rihanna takes US Super Bowl by storm, reveals second pregnancy
description: Superstar's first live event in seven years featured all her greatest hits.

title: US fighter jets shoot down ‘octagonal object’ near Canada border
description: It was the fourth flying object shot down over North America by the military in eight days.
